section.p: Uploads all SDK log files from the client to the Agora server. After calling this method successfully, the SDK will trigger a callback to report whether the log file is successfully uploaded to the Agora server.
@note Do not call this method more than once per minute, otherwise the SDK reports #ERR_TOO_OFTEN (12).ã€‚

p.note: This method cannot be called more than once per minute, and will return after exceeding.

section.p: For easier debugging, Agora recommends that you bind this method to the UI element of your App, so as to instruct the user to upload a log file when a quality issue occurs.

pd.p: The unique ID of this request. The request ID is consistent with the requestId in the callback. You can associate specific uploads with callbacks through requestId.

ul.li:
< 0: Failure.
-12(ERR_TOO_OFTEN): The call frequency exceeds the limit.
Method call succeeded: Return the request ID. The request ID is consistent with the requestId in the callback. You can associate specific uploads with callbacks through requestId.
If the call fails, returns NO. 5: The method call frequency exceeds the limit.
